name: Circulation at the Origin
conclusion: The origin is a circulation (centre) of the given system of differential equations.

steps.claim: The system can be represented in matrix form as $(\begin{matrix} \dot{x} \\ \dot{y} \end{matrix}) = A (\begin{matrix} x \\ y \end{matrix}) = (\begin{matrix} -y \\ x \end{matrix})$
steps.proof-method: Rewriting the system in matrix form
By inspection from the matrix representation

steps.claim: The eigenvalues of matrix $A$ are $\lambda = i$ and $-i$

missing.statement: Calculate the eigenvalues of the matrix $A$

steps.statement: Hence, according to the Tr-Det phase diagram, this is an example of circulation.

missing.statement: Explain how the Tr-Det phase diagram leads to the conclusion of circulation given the calculated eigenvalues
